item.title: Kafka mechanism
item.description:
Kafka Architecture

Producer

Producer é€£æ¥

Producer ç™¼é€è¨Šæ¯æ™‚

  • Zookeeper / bootstrap server
  • Topics
  • Key(å¯ç‚º Null)
  • Value(å¯ç‚º Null)

Broker

  • Topic è¢«åˆ†ç‚ºå¤šå€‹ Partition

  • Partition æœƒæœ‰å¤šå€‹ Replica

  • Broker controller

    • å…¶ä¸­ä¸€å€‹ Broker æœƒè¢«æ¨é¸ç‚º Controller
    • è² è²¬åµæ¸¬ Broker ç´šåˆ¥çš„ Failureï¼Œå¹«å¿™æ‰€æœ‰å—å½±éŸ¿çš„ Partition æ›´æ› Partition Leader

Message

  • Kafka çš„è¨Šæ¯ç‚ºéµå€¼å°ï¼Œä½¿ç”¨éµå€¼å°å¯ä»¥æä¾› Key -> Partition -> Offset çš„æŸ¥è©¢

Topic

  • Topic ç‚ºè¨Šæ¯çš„æŠ½è±¡åˆ†é¡
  • Producers ç™¼é€è¨Šæ¯æ™‚ï¼ŒæœƒæŒ‡å®šä¸€è‡³å¤šå€‹ Topicsã€‚Consumers è¨‚é–±ä¸€æˆ–å¤šå€‹ Topics
  • Topics åˆ†ç‚º Regular Topics åŠ Compacted topics
  • Regular Topics éœ€è¦è¨­å®š retention timeï¼Œè¶…éå‰‡ Kafka å¯åˆªé™¤è³‡æ–™ä»¥é‡‹å‡ºç¡¬ç¢Ÿç©ºé–“
  • Compacted Topics å‰‡è¨Šæ¯æ²’æœ‰æœ‰æ•ˆæœŸé™ï¼Œå”¯è‹¥ Key é‡è¤‡ï¼Œæ–°è¨Šæ¯æœƒè¦†è“‹èˆŠçš„è¨Šæ¯ã€‚Producer å¯ç™¼é€å€¼ç‚º null çš„éµå€¼å°ä»¥æ°¸ä¹…åˆªé™¤è©²è³‡æ–™ï¼Œç¨±ä½œ tombstone message

Partition

  • å»ºç«‹ Topic æ™‚éœ€è¦æŒ‡å®š Partitions æ•¸ç›®ï¼Œä¹‹å¾Œåªèƒ½å¢åŠ ä¸èƒ½æ¸›å°‘
  • Partition æ˜¯ Queueï¼Œè¨Šæ¯æŒ‰ offset åš´æ ¼æ’åºï¼Œæ–°è¨Šæ¯è¢« append è‡³å°¾ç«¯
  • ç”±æ–¼æ˜¯ç£ç¢Ÿçš„é€£çºŒå€åŸŸï¼Œå› æ­¤æ•ˆç‡å¾ˆé«˜

Partition offset

  • è¨Šæ¯åœ¨ partition è£¡é¢çš„ indexï¼Œç¨±ä½œ offsetï¼Œç‚º Long å‹æ…‹çš„æ•´æ•¸

Replica

  • Partition ç”¢ç”Ÿ n å€‹å‰¯æœ¬ï¼Œåˆ†æ•£è‡³å„å€‹ Broker ä¸Šï¼Œn ç¨±ä½œ replication-factor
  • æˆåŠŸåŒæ­¥çš„ Replica ç¨±ä½œ ISR

Partition Leader

  • Broker Controller å°æ¯å€‹ Partition æŒ‡å®šä¸€å€‹ Leader

  • Partition Leader è² è²¬æ¥æ”¶è³‡æ–™ï¼Œæ¥æ”¶ä¸¦å¯«å…¥å¾Œï¼Œå°‡è³‡æ–™ replicate åˆ°å…¨éƒ¨ replica/partition follower

  • Partition Follower

    • åŒä¸€ Partition çš„ non-leader replica
    • æ¦‚å¿µä¸Šç‚ºåªè¿½éš¨æŸå€‹ partition çš„ Consumerï¼Œåª subscribe partition Leaderï¼Œç™¼ç¾æ›´æ–°æ™‚ pull åˆ°æœ¬åœ°ç«¯
    • ç•¶ Partition Leader å¤±æ•ˆï¼ŒBroker Controller å¾ ISR ä¸­é¸å‡ºæ–° Leader

  • ISR

    • ç•¶ Leader æ”¶åˆ°è¨Šæ¯æ™‚ï¼Œæ‰€æœ‰ Follower éƒ½éœ€è¦å¯«å…¥ï¼Œå·²ç¶“æ›´æ–°è‡³å’Œ Leader åŒæ­¥çš„ Followers ç¨±ç‚º ISRs(in-sync replica)
    • Record åªæœ‰åœ¨å…¨éƒ¨çš„ ISR éƒ½åŒæ­¥æ™‚ï¼Œæ‰è¢«è¦–ç‚ºæˆåŠŸ Commited
    • Consumer åªèƒ½å¾å·²ç¶“ Commit æˆåŠŸçš„ Record è®€å–ç´€éŒ„
    • å°æ–¼ä¸€å€‹ Topicï¼Œåªè¦å„å€‹ Partition çš†æœ‰ä¸€å€‹ ISR åœ¨ç·šï¼Œå‰‡å…§å®¹ä¿æŒä¸€è‡´ä¸”æœå‹™ä¸ä¸­æ–·

Kafka Cluster

  • n å€‹ Broker çµ„æˆ Cluster
  • å¯ä»¥ zero downtime æ“´å±•

ZooKeeper

  • ç®¡ç†å¢é›†é…ç½®
  • è² è²¬ç®¡ç†åŠå”èª¿ Broker
  • é€šçŸ¥ Producer åŠ Consumer
    • æ–°çš„ Broker å‡ºç¾
    • Broker failure
  • ç•¶ Zookeeper ç™¼å‡ºé€šçŸ¥ï¼ŒConsumer åŠ Producer æ ¹æ“šé€šçŸ¥æ±ºå®šè¦ä½¿ç”¨å“ªä¸€å€‹ Broker
  • https://zookeeper.apache.org/

References

  • https://github.com/abhioncbr/Kafka-Message-Server/wiki/Apache-of-Kafka-Architecture-(As-per-Apache-Kafka-0.8.0-Dcoumentation)
  • https://medium.com/@poyu677/apache-kafka-ç°¡æ˜“å…¥é–€-db58898a3fab

item.title: Kafka with multi brokers
item.description:
Prerequisite

# this will install java 1.8, zookeeper, and kafka
brew install kafka

å•Ÿå‹• zookeeper

brew services start zookeeper

é–‹å•Ÿä¸‰å€‹ Brokers

åˆ†åˆ«ä¿®æ”¹ server1.properties, server2.properties

ä¿®æ”¹ä½ç½® server.properties server1.properties server2.properties
broker.id broker.id=0 broker.id=1 broker.id=2
listeners listeners=PLAINTEXT://:9092 listeners=PLAINTEXT://:9093 listeners=PLAINTEXT://:9094
log.dir log.dir=/usr/local/var/lib/kafka-logs-0 log.dir=/usr/local/var/lib/kafka-logs-1 log.dir=/usr/local/var/lib/kafka-logs-2 
kafka-server-start /usr/local/etc/kafka/server.properties &
kafka-server-start /usr/local/etc/kafka/server1.properties &
kafka-server-start /usr/local/etc/kafka/server2.properties &

é–‹å•Ÿä¸€å€‹å…©å€‹å‰¯æœ¬çš„ Topic

kafka-topics â€“create â€“zookeeper localhost:2181 â€“replication-factor 3 â€“partitions 1 â€“topic mytopic

item.description:
Install Kafka

# å»ºä¸€å€‹åç‚º test-kafka çš„ Topic

item.title: Some of Kafka terminology
item.description:
Kafka Architecture

Producers

  • è² è²¬å°‡è¨Šæ¯ push åˆ° Kafka clusterï¼Œä»»ä½•å¯¦ä½œ Producer API çš„ Client

Consumers

  • å¾ Kafka cluster pull è¨Šæ¯ï¼Œä»»ä½•å¯¦ä½œ Consumer API çš„ Client
  • Consumer group: å¤šå€‹ Consumer å¯çµ„æˆ Consumer group

Brokers

  • Broker: Kafka çš„å–®ä¸€ç¯€é»ç¨±ä½œ Broker
  • Kafka Cluster: å¤šå€‹ broker çµ„æˆ Kafka Cluster
  • Broker å¯ä»¥èªªæ˜¯ Apache Kafka çš„ Server ç«¯ï¼Œä»²ä»‹è™•ç† Client(Consumer ä»¥åŠ Producer)çš„è¨Šæ¯

Message

  • Kafka çš„è¨Šæ¯ç‚ºéµå€¼å°ï¼Œæä¾› Topic + Key å° Partition çš„æŸ¥è©¢

Topic

  • Topic ç‚ºè¨Šæ¯çš„æŠ½è±¡åˆ†é¡
  • Producers ç™¼é€è¨Šæ¯æ™‚æŒ‡å®š Topic
  • Consumers è¨‚é–± Topic
  • Topic è¢«åˆ†ç‚ºå¤šå€‹ Partition
  • Partition æœƒæœ‰å¤šå€‹ Replica

Partition

  • å»ºç«‹ Topic æ™‚éœ€è¦æŒ‡å®š Partitions æ•¸ç›®ï¼ŒTopic æœƒè¢«åˆ†ç‚ºå¤šå€‹ Partitionï¼ŒPartition æ•¸ç›®ä¹‹å¾Œåªèƒ½å¢åŠ ä¸èƒ½æ¸›å°‘

  • Partition offset: è¨Šæ¯åœ¨ partition è£¡é¢çš„ indexï¼Œç¨±ä½œ offsetï¼Œç‚º Long å‹æ…‹çš„æ•´æ•¸

Replica

  • replication-factor: Partition ç”¢ç”Ÿ n å€‹å‰¯æœ¬ï¼Œåˆ†æ•£è‡³å„å€‹ Broker ä¸Š
  • ISR: æˆåŠŸåŒæ­¥çš„ Replica ç¨±ä½œ ISR
  • Replica ç”¨æ–¼ä¿è­‰åˆ†æ•£å¼ç³»çµ±çš„é«˜å¯ç”¨

ZooKeeper

  • Apache çš„å¦ä¸€å€‹åˆ†æ•£å¼å°ˆæ¡ˆï¼Œå¯ç®¡ç†ç³»çµ±é…ç½®
  • è² è²¬ Kafka çš„ä»¥ä¸‹åŠŸèƒ½
    • å„²å­˜ metadata
    • é¸èˆ‰ controller/leader
    • Consumer group ç™¼ç”Ÿè®ŠåŒ–æ™‚ï¼Œé€²è¡Œ rebalance
    • ç•¶ Producer æŒ‡å®š ZK(è€Œé bootstrap server)ï¼ŒZK è² è²¬è¿”å› broker list
  • Kafka Improvement Proposals å·²ç¶“é€šéï¼Œå°‡ Zookeeper å¾ Kafka ç§»é™¤ï¼Œä½¿ç”¨ bootstrap server/broker controller/å…±è­˜ä¾†ç¶­è­· Kafka ï¼Œhttps://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/KAFKA/KIP-500%3A+Replace+ZooKeeper+with+a+Self-Managed+Metadata+Quorum

item.title: What is Kafka
item.description:
What is ELK

ELK æ˜¯ç”± Elasticsearch, Logstash åŠ Kibana çµ„æˆçš„å †ç–Š ç”±æ–¼ Logstash æ•ˆèƒ½ä¸ä½³ï¼Œå› æ­¤å¾Œé¢åŠ å…¥äº† Beatsï¼Œç¨±ä½œ Elastic Stack ä»¥ä¸Šè»Ÿé«”çš†ç”± Elastic NV é–‹ç™¼ã€‚

What is Elasticsearch

  • Elasticsearch æ˜¯å€‹åˆ†æ•£å¼ï¼Œæ”¯æ´å¤šç§Ÿæˆ¶çš„å…¨æ–‡æœå°‹å¼•æ“ï¼Œä»–çš„æœå°‹å¼•æ“æ˜¯åŸºæ–¼ Apache Lucene æ”¹å¯«ã€‚
  • Elasticsearch ç”± Java ç·¨å¯«ï¼Œç›®å‰ç”± Elastic NV å…¬å¸ç¶­è­·ï¼Œæ ¸å¿ƒåŸå§‹ç¢¼ç‚º Apache 2.0 é–‹æºï¼Œå¹³å°åŠå‘¨é‚ŠåŸºæ–¼ Elastic Licenseã€‚

Elasticsearch Features

  • åˆ†æ•£å¼ï¼Œå¯æ“´å±•
  • å¤šç§Ÿæˆ¶
  • RESTfulï¼Œä½¿ç”¨ JSON å’Œ Java API

How does Elasticsearch works

item.title: What is Kafka
item.description:
Kafka æ˜¯ä¸€å€‹åˆ†æ•£å¼çš„è¨Šæ¯è™•ç†å¹³å°(message processing platform)ï¼Œä»²ä»‹è™•ç†ç«¯åˆ°ç«¯çš„å¯¦æ™‚è¨Šæ¯å‚³è¼¸ã€‚

Kafka ç‰¹é»

  • å¯ä»¥è‡ªç”±èª¿æ•´ C/A/P
  • æ¸›å°‘ç¶²è·¯å°åŒ…çš„ Overhead: ä½¿ç”¨å„ªåŒ–éçš„ binary TCP-based protocolï¼Œå¤šæ¢è¨Šæ¯æœƒå…ˆå¯«å…¥è¨˜æ†¶é«”ç·©è¡ä¸­å­˜æˆ Batch ä¸€åŒå‚³è¼¸ï¼Œ
  • è¼•é‡ç´šå¯å£“ç¸®: é¿å…å°è¨Šæ¯çš„ç‰©ä»¶åŒ…è¦†ï¼Œä»¥æª”æ¡ˆçš„å‹å¼ä¾†è™•ç†è³‡æ–™
  • ä½¿ç”¨ OS çš„ page cacheï¼Œä¸éœ€è¦é¡å¤– Applicaion Cache ï¼Œçˆ­å–çè²´çš„è¨˜æ†¶é«”ç©ºé–“

Kafka å„ªé»

  • Reliability
  • Scalability
  • Durability
  • Performance
  • Fault Tolerance
  • Zero downtime

item.title: Kafka + ELK
item.description:
Repos

https://github.com/wurstmeister/kafka-dockers

ç’°å¢ƒ

  • macOS Catalina 10.15.3
  • kafka 2.4.0 (installed by Homebrew)
  • Docker Desktop 2.2.0.0

æº–å‚™ Image

  • wurstmeister/zookeeper
  • wurstmeister/kafka
  • sebp/elk
docker pull wurstmeister/zookeeper
docker pull wurstmeister/kafka
docker pull sebp/elk

Zookeeper

docker run --name zk -p 2181:2181 -p 2888:2888 -p 3888:3888 --restart always -d zookeeper

Kafka


docker run -d --name kafka -p 9092:9092 --link zk --env KAFKA_ZOOKEEPER_CONNECT=zk:2181 --env KAFKA_ADVERTISED_HOST_NAME=${host_ip} --env KAFKA_ADVERTISED_PORT=9092 wurstmeister/kafka

é–‹å€‹ Topics æ¸¬è©¦ä¸€ä¸‹

host_ip="HOST_IP"

kafka-topics --create --zookeeper ${host_ip}:2181 --replication-factor 1 --partitions 1 --topic elk_test

kafka-topics --describe --zookeeper ${host_ip}:2181

ä¸æ”¾å¿ƒçš„è©±å†å¯«å€‹è¨Šæ¯

kafka-topics --create --zookeeper ${host_ip}:2181 --replication-factor 1 --partitions 1 --topic kfk_test

kafka-console-producer --broker-list ${host_ip}:9092 --topic kfk_test
>
# è¼¸å…¥
# Control+C é—œæ‰

kafka-console-consumer --topic=kfk_test --bootstrap-server=${host_ip}:9092 --from-beginning

ELK

Elasticsearch å¥½åƒå¾ˆåƒ Memory

screen /Users/peteeelol/Library/Containers/com.docker.docker/Data//vms/0/tty

sysctl -w vm.max_map_count=262144

docker run -d -p 5601:5601 -p 9200:9200 -p 9300:9300 -p 5044:5044 -e ES_MIN_MEM=128m -e ES_MAX_MEM=2048m -it --name elk sebp/elk

æª¢æŸ¥

# Kibana
open http://"${host_ip}":5601

# docker
$ docker exec elk jps
105 Elasticsearch
313 Logstash
415 Jps

è¨­å®š Logstash

ç°¡å–®æ¸¬è©¦

$ docker exec -it elk /bin/bash

service --status-all

service logstash stop

/opt/logstash/bin/logstash -e 'input { stdin { } } output { elasticsearch { hosts => ["localhost"] } }'
...
...
...
Hello
# Control + C é›¢é–‹stdin

æœ€å¾Œä¸€å€‹æŒ‡ä»¤éœ€è¦è·‘ä¸€ä¸‹ï¼Œæ¥è‘—è¼¸å…¥ä¸€äº›è¨Šæ¯

é›¢é–‹ Docker ç”¨ Host(Mac) æ‰“é–‹ç€è¦½å™¨

open http://localhost:9200/_search?pretty

æ‡‰è©²è¦èƒ½çœ‹åˆ°å‰›å‰› stdin è¼¸å…¥çš„è¨Šæ¯

è¨­å®šæª”

å›åˆ° Container elk

vim /etc/logstash/conf.d/kafka.conf

input {
    kafka {
        bootstrap_servers => ["HOST_IP:9092"]
        group_id => "test-consumer-group"
        auto_offset_reset => "latest"
        consumer_threads => 5
        decorate_events => true
        topics => ["elk_topics"]
        type => "bhy"
    }
}

output {
    elasticsearch {
        hosts => ["http://localhost:9200"]
        index => "myservice-%{+YYYY.MM.dd}"
        #user => "elastic"
        #password => "changeme"
    }
}

æ›´æ”¹ Logstash æ¬Šé™

vim /etc/init.d/logstash

å°‡ LS_USER, LS_GROUP æ›´æ”¹ç‚º root

LS_USER=root
LS_GROUP=root

å†æŠŠ Logstash é‡è·‘

service logstash restart

é€™æ™‚å€™ Logstash æ‡‰è©²å°±æœ‰åœ¨æ¥æ”¶ Kafka çš„ elk_topics é€™å€‹ Topic äº†ï¼Œå¯ä»¥ç”¨ Host ç™¼é€è¨Šæ¯æ¸¬è©¦çœ‹çœ‹

kafka-console-producer --broker-list ${host_ip}:9092 --topic elk_topics

åœ¨ Kibana æ‡‰è©²è¦çœ‹åˆ° index ç‚º my-service é–‹é ­çš„è¨Šæ¯ï¼Œä»£è¡¨è¨Šæ¯é€é Kafka-> Logstash -> Elastic Search

item.title: Kafka Connect Quickstart
item.description:
Slighty modified from Confluent's example. Only version is updated.

  • confluent platform docker version 5.4.0
  • mysql version 8.0.19

Note that docker-compose.yml is slightly modified from cp-all-in-one in order to be easily understood.

The docker images is NOT Size-Mininized.

Prerequisites

  • Docker
  • Docker Compose
  • curl
  • Docker-Machine
    Docker for mac is not as native as Linux. Weird network behavior may occur.
    Better use docker-machine to avoid it.

(Mac) Start Docker-Machine

# if using docker-machine
if [ docker-machine >/dev/null 2>&1 ]
then
    docker-machine create --driver virtualbox --virtualbox-memory 6000 confluent
else
    echo "Docker is native on your system"
fi
echo "continue"

Docker machine "confluent" already exists
continue

docker-machine start confluent
echo "continue"

Starting "confluent"...
Machine "confluent" is already running.
continue

if [ docker-machine >/dev/null 2>&1 ]
then
    eval $(docker-machine env confluent)
else
    echo "Docker is native on your system"
fi

Download MySQL JDBC Driver

It is important to make sure the version of MySQL-JDBC match the version of MySQL.

docker-compose stop
echo
docker-compose rm -f

Stopping control-center  ...
Stopping connect         ...
Stopping schema-registry ...
Stopping broker          ...
Stopping zookeeper       ...
[1Bping zookeeper       ... [32mdone[0m
Going to remove control-center, quickstart-mysql, connect, schema-registry, broker, zookeeper
Removing control-center   ...
Removing quickstart-mysql ...
Removing connect          ...
Removing schema-registry  ...
Removing broker           ...
Removing zookeeper        ...
[6Bving control-center   ... [32mdone[0m

docker run --rm mysql --version

/usr/sbin/mysqld  Ver 8.0.19 for Linux on x86_64 (MySQL Community Server - GPL)

if [ docker-machine >/dev/null 2>&1 ]
then
    docker-machine ssh confluent -- \
    """
    sudo mkdir -p /tmp/quickstart/jars;
    sudo curl -k \
        -s \
        -SL \
        \"http://dev.mysql.com/get/Downloads/Connector-J/mysql-connector-java-8.0.19.tar.gz\" |
        sudo tar -xzf - -C \
            /tmp/quickstart/jars \
            --strip-components=1 \
            mysql-connector-java-8.0.19/mysql-connector-java-8.0.19.jar;
    ls -la /tmp/quickstart/jars
    """
else
    sudo mkdir -p /tmp/quickstart/jars;
    sudo curl -k \
        -s \
        -SL \
        \"http://dev.mysql.com/get/Downloads/Connector-J/mysql-connector-java-8.0.19.tar.gz\" |
        sudo tar -xzf - -C \
            /tmp/quickstart/jars \
            --strip-components=1 \
            mysql-connector-java-8.0.19/mysql-connector-java-8.0.19.jar;
    ls -la /tmp/quickstart/jars
fi

MySQL-JDBC

  • MySQL Engineering Blogs
  • mvnrepository

Start Docker Compose

docker-compose up -d

Creating zookeeper ...

Insert data into MySQL

MySQL container may take a while until it can function.

# Nasty script to wait for mysql be ready
while ! docker exec quickstart-mysql mysql --user=confluent --password=confluent -e "SELECT 1" >/dev/null 2>&1; do
    sleep 1
done

docker exec -i quickstart-mysql mysql -u confluent -pconfluent <<< """
CREATE DATABASE IF NOT EXISTS connect_test;
USE connect_test;

DROP TABLE IF EXISTS test;

CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS test (
  id serial NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY,
  name varchar(100),
  email varchar(200),
  department varchar(200),
  modified timestamp default CURRENT_TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
  INDEX \`modified_index\` (\`modified\`)
);

INSERT INTO test (name, email, department) VALUES ('alice', 'alice@abc.com', 'engineering');
INSERT INTO test (name, email, department) VALUES ('bob', 'bob@abc.com', 'sales');
INSERT INTO test (name, email, department) VALUES ('bob', 'bob@abc.com', 'sales');
INSERT INTO test (name, email, department) VALUES ('bob', 'bob@abc.com', 'sales');
INSERT INTO test (name, email, department) VALUES ('bob', 'bob@abc.com', 'sales');
INSERT INTO test (name, email, department) VALUES ('bob', 'bob@abc.com', 'sales');
INSERT INTO test (name, email, department) VALUES ('bob', 'bob@abc.com', 'sales');
INSERT INTO test (name, email, department) VALUES ('bob', 'bob@abc.com', 'sales');
INSERT INTO test (name, email, department) VALUES ('bob', 'bob@abc.com', 'sales');
INSERT INTO test (name, email, department) VALUES ('bob', 'bob@abc.com', 'sales');
SELECT * FROM test;
"""

mysql: [Warning] Using a password on the command line interface can be insecure.

Source Connector

Add source connector

Either API or Web UI(Confluent Platform) will acheive the goal.

export CONNECT_NET="kafka-connect-mysql_default"

We have to wait for Kafka Connect to totally start up.

To speed up the process, remove some directory from CONNECT_PLUGIN_PATH

      #CONNECT_PLUGIN_PATH: "/usr/share/java,/usr/share/confluent-hub-components"
      CONNECT_PLUGIN_PATH: "\
        /usr/share/java/kafka,\
        /usr/share/confluent-hub-components,\
        /usr/share/java/kafka-connect-jdbc,\
        /etc/kafka-connect/jars"

while ! docker logs connect 2>&1 | grep -i "INFO Kafka Connect started" ; do
     sleep 1
done

[2020-03-02 22:32:15,768] INFO Kafka Connect started (org.apache.kafka.connect.runtime.Connect)

# Call the API of connect
docker run \
    --net="${CONNECT_NET}" \
    --rm curlimages/curl:7.68.0 \
    -X POST \
    -s \
    -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --data '{ "name": "quickstart-jdbc-source", "config": { "connector.class": "io.confluent.connect.jdbc.JdbcSourceConnector", "tasks.max": 1, "connection.url": "jdbc:mysql://quickstart-mysql:3306/connect_test?user=root&password=confluent", "mode": "incrementing", "incrementing.column.name": "id", "timestamp.column.name": "modified", "topic.prefix": "quickstart-jdbc-", "poll.interval.ms": 1000 } }' \
    http://connect:8083/connectors

{"name":"quickstart-jdbc-source","config":{"connector.class":"io.confluent.connect.jdbc.JdbcSourceConnector","tasks.max":"1","connection.url":"jdbc:mysql://quickstart-mysql:3306/connect_test?user=root&password=confluent","mode":"incrementing","incrementing.column.name":"id","timestamp.column.name":"modified","topic.prefix":"quickstart-jdbc-","poll.interval.ms":"1000","name":"quickstart-jdbc-source"},"tasks":[],"type":"source"}

If error message is received

Make sure MySQL-JDBC JAR file is correctly mounted to container.

docker exec connect env | grep -e "^CONNECT_PLUGIN_PATH"

CONNECT_PLUGIN_PATH=/usr/share/java/kafka,/usr/share/confluent-hub-components,/usr/share/java/kafka-connect-jdbc,/etc/kafka-connect/jars

docker exec connect ls -la /etc/kafka-connect/jars

total 2312
drwxr-xr-x 2 root root    4096 Mar  2 22:27 .
drwxrwxrwx 1 root root    4096 Mar  2 22:28 ..
-rw-r--r-- 1 root root 2356711 Dec  4 11:44 mysql-connector-java-8.0.19.jar

Higher the logging level from docker-compose.yml and run again

    #CONNECT_LOG4J_ROOT_LOGLEVEL: "DEBUG"

Status Check

# Check if new topic is created
docker run \
    --net="${CONNECT_NET}" \
    --rm \
    confluentinc/cp-kafka:5.4.0 \
    kafka-topics --describe \
    --zookeeper zookeeper:2181 \
    --topic quickstart-jdbc-test

Topic: quickstart-jdbc-test	PartitionCount: 1	ReplicationFactor: 1	Configs:
    Topic: quickstart-jdbc-test	Partition: 0	Leader: 1	Replicas: 1	Isr: 1

docker exec schema-registry \
    kafka-avro-console-consumer \
    --bootstrap-server broker:29092 \
    --topic quickstart-jdbc-test \
    --from-beginning \
    --property print.key=true \
    --max-messages 10 | \
    grep -e "^null"

Sink Connector

Add sink connector

# Call the API of connect
docker run \
    --net="${CONNECT_NET}" \
    --rm \
    curlimages/curl:7.68.0 \
    -s -X POST \
    -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
    --data '{"name": "quickstart-avro-file-sink", "config": {"connector.class":"org.apache.kafka.connect.file.FileStreamSinkConnector", "tasks.max":"1", "topics":"quickstart-jdbc-test", "file": "/tmp/quickstart/jdbc-output.txt"}}' \
    http://connect:8083/connectors

{"name":"quickstart-avro-file-sink","config":{"connector.class":"org.apache.kafka.connect.file.FileStreamSinkConnector","tasks.max":"1","topics":"quickstart-jdbc-test","file":"/tmp/quickstart/jdbc-output.txt","name":"quickstart-avro-file-sink"},"tasks":[],"type":"sink"}

Status check (Sink)

# Check connector status through API
docker run \
    --net="${CONNECT_NET}" \
    --rm \
    curlimages/curl:7.68.0 \
    -s -X GET http://connect:8083/connectors/quickstart-avro-file-sink/status

{"name":"quickstart-avro-file-sink","connector":{"state":"RUNNING","worker_id":"connect:8083"},"tasks":[{"id":0,"state":"RUNNING","worker_id":"connect:8083"}],"type":"sink"}

Results

# if using docker-machine
if [ docker-machine >/dev/null 2>&1 ]
then
    docker-machine ssh confluent -- cat /tmp/quickstart/file/jdbc-output.txt
else
    cat /tmp/quickstart/file/jdbc-output.txt
fi
